page.title: 20Liathach,Torridon Mountain
page.content: Liathach,(grey one)3,456ft,dominates the village of Torridon.It is mostly red Torridonian sandstone with loose scree and a quartzite summit.Buttress formations sandstone bands are easily seen.These mountains are around 750 million years old and of interest to climbers, geologists and naturalists. There are easy walks up Liathach,but also climbs that challenge experienced mountaineers.Sometimes the rocks can be heard thundering down the slopes. About a hundred years ago a landslip & flood engulfed the clachan, destroying the houses.The people fled,but had not time to free all their livestock,which lived in the same buildings. The new settlement was rebuilt nearer the sea. Vegetation is sparse,mostly shrubs,low growing plants & heathers,which give a purple haze in autumn,while in summer, ubiquitous bracken gives a green cover
